agave.internal
Interface URIPattern

All Superinterfaces:
java.lang.Comparable<URIPattern>
All Known Implementing Classes:
URIPatternImpl
public interface URIPattern
extends java.lang.Comparable<URIPattern>

The URIPattern is an object constructed around the the argument to the @HandlesRequestsTo annotation, and it indicates which URL the handler method will field, based on the URL constructed by combining the protocol, port, context, and URI.

Author:
Damian Carrillo

Method Detail

getPattern

java.lang.String getPattern()

matches

boolean matches(java.lang.String uri)
Determines whether the supplied URI string matches the pattern that this URIPattern encapsulates. The URI string supplied as an argument must start with a forward slash ('/'). The URI string is normalized with URI.normalize() from the Java API, then compared against the stored pattern where wildcards and replacement variables help determine the match. Replacement variables look like ${someVar} and are taken as an automatic match. A single asterisk represents a wildcard match where the supplied token matches automatically as well. A double asterisk matches multiple tokens until the next token in the pattern is matched against the URI.

Parameters:
uri - the URI string
Returns:
true if the URI matches this pattern

normalizeURI

java.lang.String normalizeURI(java.lang.String uriStr)
Normalizes the URI string so that .. and . are properly handled and condensed.

Parameters:
uriStr - the URI string to normalize
Returns:
the normalized URI string

hashCode

int hashCode()

compareTo

int compareTo(URIPattern that)
Compares two URIPatterns for greater specificity. A more specific URIPattern should always be sorted before a more generic one.

Specified by:
compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<URIPattern>
Parameters:
that - the URIPattern to compare against
Returns:
-1 if this URIPattern is more specific, 0 if they are equal in specificity and 1 if that URIPattern is more specific
